info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 6 at 4:56AM EDT until August 6 at 6:15AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Georgia, including the following county, Elbert.
* WHEN...Until 615 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, including in urban areas around the city of Elberton. Near bankfull conditions and high flows will continue on small streams, especially along Wahachee Creek, Falling Creek, and other tributaries of the Broad River. These creeks and others may flood low water crossings.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 449 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Although rain has recently become lighter, more heavy rain will move over the Advisory area through sunrise, and additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible. This rainfall could cause the runoff situation to worsen, and it's possible that an upgrade to a Flash Flood Warning will become necessary before 6 AM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elberton, Middleton, Russell State Park, Nancy Hart State Park, Sweet City, Ruckersville, Fortsonia, Dewy Rose, Rock Branch and Rice Town. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via X using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not drive across flooded roads. Turn around, don't drown.
